commit_message:
move aclmanager.py from release-tools repo

The aclmanager script needs to be able to get a list of repositories
with the cycle-with-milestone release model, and the data for that lives
in this repository now instead of the governance repository. Rather than
having a tool that relies on this data live in release-tools, move it
here.

Change-Id: I7c2c54c4949829aea92e569e3ac9ec9007d932ed
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/99/417899/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/python # # Handle pre-release / post-release ACLs for milestone-driven projects # # Copyright 2016 Thierry Carrez <thierry@openstack.org> # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import argparse import getpass import os import sys import requests import yaml import openstack_releases from openstack_releases import deliverable GERRIT_URL = 'https://review.openstack.org/' EXCEPTIONS = ['openstack/training-labs', 'openstack/murano-apps', 'openstack/trove-image-builder'] def repositories_list(deliverables_dir, series): """Yields (team, repo) tuples for cycle-with-milestones deliverables""" deliverables = deliverable.Deliverables(deliverables_dir) for team, series, dname, dinfo in deliverables.get_deliverables(None, series): d = deliverable.Deliverable(team, series, dname, dinfo) if d.model != 'cycle-with-milestones': continue for repo in sorted(d.repos): yield (d.team, repo) def patch_acls(args): """Handles the acls action""" blob = """[access "refs/heads/stable/{branch}"] abandon = group Change Owner abandon = group Project Bootstrappers abandon = group {group} exclusiveGroupPermissions = abandon label-Code-Review label-Workflow label-Code-Review = -2..+2 group Project Bootstrappers label-Code-Review = -2..+2 group {group} label-Code-Review = -1..+1 group Registered Users label-Workflow = -1..+0 group Change Owner label-Workflow = -1..+1 group Project Bootstrappers label-Workflow = -1..+1 group {group} """ # Load repo/aclfile mapping from Gerrit config projectsyaml = os.path.join(args.repository, 'gerrit', 'projects.yaml') acl = {} config = yaml.load(open(projectsyaml)) for project in config: aclfilename = project.get('acl-config') if aclfilename: (head, tail) = os.path.split(aclfilename) acl[project['project']] = os.path.join(os.path.basename(head), tail) else: acl[project['project']] = project['project'] + '.config' # Get the list of ACL files to update aclfiles = {} for team, repo in repositories_list(args.deliverables_dir, args.series): try: aclfiles[acl[repo]] = team except KeyError: print('No ACL file defined for %s' % repo) sys.exit(1) for aclfn, teamname in aclfiles.items(): newcontent = '' fullfilename = os.path.join(args.repository, 'gerrit', 'acls', aclfn) group = '%s-release-branch' % teamname print('Patching %s' % fullfilename) if args.dryrun: print('Adding stable/%s ACL with rights for %s' % (args.series, group)) else: with open(fullfilename) as aclfile: hit = False for line in aclfile: if line.startswith("[receive]"): newcontent += blob.format( branch=args.series, group=group) hit = True newcontent += line if not hit: print("Could not update %s automatically" % fullfilename) with open(fullfilename, 'w') as aclfile: aclfile.write(newcontent) def gerrit_group_membership_test(gerritauth, action, group, member): """Test for Gerrit group membership based on action taken""" call = 'a/groups/%s/groups/%s' % (group, member) r = requests.get(GERRIT_URL + call, auth=gerritauth) if action == 'PUT': # For PUT operations, return true if member is missing return r.status_code == 404 else: # For DELETE operations, return true if member already there return r.status_code == 200 def modify_gerrit_groups(args): """Handles the 'groups' action""" gerritauth = requests.auth.HTTPDigestAuth(args.username, getpass.getpass()) if args.stage == 'pre_release': # At pre-release stage we want to have $PROJECT-release and # Release Managers (and remove $PROJECT-stable-maint if present) actions = [ ('PUT', lambda x: '%s-release' % x), ('PUT', lambda x: 'Release Managers'), ('DELETE', lambda x: '%s-stable-maint' % x), ] elif args.stage == 'post_release': # At post-release stage we want to have $PROJECT-stable-maint # (and remove Release Managers and $PROJECT-release if present) actions = [ ('PUT', lambda x: '%s-stable-maint' % x), ('DELETE', lambda x: 'Release Managers'), ('DELETE', lambda x: '%s-release' % x), ] # Build the list of calls to make print('Computing the list of modifications') calls = set() for team, _ in repositories_list(): group = '%s-release-branch' % team for (verb, memberformat) in actions: member = memberformat(team) # Filter based on already-handled names if gerrit_group_membership_test(gerritauth, verb, group, member): calls.add((verb, group, member)) else: print("Skipping %s %s in %s (already done)" % (verb, member, group)) for verb, group, member in calls: call = 'a/groups/%s/groups/%s' % (group, member) print('Updating %s group using %s %s' % (group, verb, call)) if not args.dryrun: r = requests.request(verb, GERRIT_URL + call, auth=gerritauth) if r.status_code not in (201, 204): print('Error (%d) while updating group' % r.status_code) def main(args=sys.argv[1:]): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser() parser.add_argument( '--dryrun', default=False, help='do not actually do anything', action='store_true') subparsers = parser.add_subparsers(title='commands') do_acls = subparsers.add_parser( 'acls', help='patch ACL files') do_acls.add_argument( '--deliverables-dir', default=openstack_releases.deliverable_dir, help='location of deliverable files', ) do_acls.add_argument( 'repository', help='location of the local project-config repository') do_acls.add_argument( 'series', help='series to generate ACL for') do_acls.set_defaults(func=patch_acls) do_groups = subparsers.add_parser( 'groups', help='modify Gerrit groups membership') do_groups.add_argument( 'stage', choices=['pre_release', 'post_release'], help='type of modification to push') do_groups.add_argument( 'username', help='gerrit HTTP username') do_groups.set_defaults(func=modify_gerrit_groups) args = parser.parse_args(args) if args.dryrun: print('Running in dry run mode, no action will be actually taken') return args.func(args) if __name__ == '__main__': main()

commit_message:
devstack: make pseudo agent port binding as default

This patch enables pseudo agent port binding mechanism
to be default case for port binding instead of network
topology.

Change-Id: Ibbd9ee706c8bc56c43c84bcff9be329513649df6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/98/382598/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: network-topology) *) ODL_PORT_BINDING_CONTROLLER=pseudo-agentdb-binding ;;

commit_message:
Additional checks for ceilometers and designate scenarios

Patch adds verification of resuls of creation and list actions.
Patch contains changes in both scenarios and unit tests and affect on following scenarios:
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/ceilometer/events.py
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/ceilometer/resources.py
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/designate/basic.py
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/glance/images.py
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/heat/stacks.py
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/ironic/nodes.py
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/keystone/basic.py
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/magnum/clusters.py
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/manila/shares.py

Change-Id: I5b0156c809cc4be3e265198e64fea1e9251c78a9

deleted_lines: if not resources: msg = ("No resources found for tenant: %s" % self.context["tenant"].get("name")) raise exceptions.NotFoundException(message=msg)

commit_message:
Disable creation of public shares per configuration

Fix [1] for bug [2] disabled creating of public share types
per configuration but did not address the part of the bug
that required disabling of public *share* creation per
configuration.

Fix that here.

[1] Ia3808486b8604270127c22d45e455e1955b36dba
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila-ui/+bug/1593057

Change-Id: I0c256d0007395e659f804e8874424f4148021ca8
Closes-bug: #1650610
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila-ui refs/changes/91/411891/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.conf import settings manila_features = getattr(settings, 'OPENSTACK_MANILA_FEATURES', {}) self.enable_public_shares = manila_features.get( 'enable_public_shares', True) if self.enable_public_shares: self.fields['is_public'] = forms.BooleanField( label=_("Make visible for all"), required=False, help_text=( "If set then all tenants will be able to see this share.")) is_public = self.enable_public_shares and data['is_public'] is_public=is_public, def __init__(self, request, *args, **kwargs): super(UpdateForm, self).__init__(request, *args, **kwargs) manila_features = getattr(settings, 'OPENSTACK_MANILA_FEATURES', {}) self.enable_public_shares = manila_features.get( 'enable_public_shares', True) if not self.enable_public_shares: self.fields.pop('is_public') is_public = data['is_public'] if self.enable_public_shares else False is_public=is_public)
deleted_lines: self.fields['is_public'] = forms.BooleanField( label=_("Make visible for all"), required=False, help_text=( "If set then all tenants will be able to see this share.")) is_public=data['is_public'], is_public=data['is_public'])

Add spec file for python-ntplib

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/46/417846/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: %global sname ntplib Name: {{ py2name('ntplib') }} Version: 0.3.3 Release: 0 Summary: Simple interface to query NTP servers from Python. License: {{ license('MIT') }} Group: Development/Languages/Python Url: https://code.google.com/archive/p/ntplib/ Source0: https://pypi.io/packages/source/m/%{sname}/%{sname}-%{version}.tar.gz BuildArch: noarch %description This module offers a simple interface to query NTP servers from Python. It also provides utility functions to translate NTP fields values to text (mode, leap indicator…). Since it’s pure Python, and only depends on core modules, it should work on any platform with a Python implementation. %prep %autosetup -n %{sname}-%{version} %py_req_cleanup %install %{py2_install} %check %{__python2} -m unittest discover %files %doc CHANGELOG %{python2_sitelib}/ntplib %{python2_sitelib}/*.egg-info %changelog

commit_message:
Replaced e.message with str(e)

For logging the exception message: e.message has been
deprecated. The preferred way is to call str(e).

Change-Id: If14adfb9eae5fcd95822b07cea3bd66d16dacea2

commit_message:
Python3 common patterns

Modify some codes in order to make them meet
the Python3 common pattern.
In this patch,I replace filter(lambda obj: test(obj),data)
with[obj for obj in data if test(obj)]

Change-Id: I68e76f91dc31aa0e00124c1eb76a0a1f0178cc44

commit_message:
Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: I41c0fb1f611507bab648c611fba751f4e114a89b
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/67/417067/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set -xeuo pipefail# Install pip. if which pip; then# Install bindep and tox with pip.if which yum; then# Get a list of packages to install with bindep. If packages need to be # installed, bindep exits with an exit code of 1. BINDEP_PKGS=$(bindep -b -f bindep.txt test || true) echo "Packages to install: ${BINDEP_PKGS}" # Install a list of OS packages provided by bindep. if which apt-get; then --assume-yes install $BINDEP_PKGS elif which yum; then # Don't run yum with an empty list of packages. # It will fail and cause the script to exit with an error. if [[ ${#BINDEP_PKGS} > 0 ]]; then sudo yum install -y $BINDEP_PKGS fi# Loop through each tox environment and run tests. for tox_env in $(awk -F= '/envlist/ { gsub(",", " "); print $2 }' tox.ini); do echo "Executing tox environment: ${tox_env}" if [[ ${tox_env} == ansible-functional ]]; then else tox -e ${tox_env}
deleted_lines: set -euov# Install pip if [ ! "$(which pip)" ]; then# Install bindep and toxif [ "$(which yum)" ]; then# Install OS packages using bindep if apt-get -v >/dev/null 2>&1 ; then --assume-yes install `bindep -b -f bindep.txt test` else sudo yum install -y `bindep -b -f bindep.txt test`# run through each tox env and execute the test for tox_env in $(awk -F= '/envlist/ {print $2}' tox.ini | sed 's/,/ /g'); do if [ "${tox_env}" != "ansible-functional" ]; then tox -e ${tox_env} elif [ "${tox_env}" == "ansible-functional" ]; then

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

Instead of assertTrue and assertFalse use more specific asserts.
They are compatible with Python 2.7[1] and 3.4[2]

[1]: https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html
[2]: https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I94cfb5353f9bee227e3ba0fa3ce0b1e09be93ddb

deleted_lines: self.assertTrue(TFields.CATEGORY in entity.properties) self.assertTrue(entity_def_dict[TFields.TEMPLATE_ID] in entities) self.assertTrue(relationship.source.vertex_id in entities) self.assertTrue(relationship.target.vertex_id in entities) self.assertTrue(template_id in relationships)

Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: I58b12b799d15ad84e1c40125aba492109cdcb130

commit_message:
Allow Apache ports to be specified per VHost

With more services moving to an Apache2 model, having a ports.conf file
becomes unmanageable - we should instead add the Listen line to each
Vhost and set a blank "ports.conf".

Change-Id: I58b12b799d15ad84e1c40125aba492109cdcb130
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/07/417907/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We place a blank file here # Listen commands happen inside the individual VHost files # This allows for multiple services VHosts to exist without # overwriting Listen lines.

Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous

commit_message:
Ensure all cinder_backends are created

Combine all cinder_volume host's "cinder_backends" var to ensure all
cinder_backends are created, and there is no race condition setting up
the same backend for multiple hosts (e.g. rbd backends which exist on
multiple volume servers).

This adds a second cinder_volume node for testing, with a new backend,
as well as the old backend - this should ensure duplicate backends are
not created whilst backends are created for each cinder_volumes host.

Change-Id: I1c2fb1ef07423fc415622767ff09f058c773c1ed
Closes-Bug: 1649914

commit_message:
Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: Idddbe91d736198fa6c98b81a125a818e68657b18
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems with dict.items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, 
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ia21d66e927380cacfd480fb58707a6c66db4b609
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/88/400588/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for name, value in sorted(d.items()):
deleted_lines: import six for name, value in sorted(six.iteritems(d)):

subject: Avoid error if optional format fields are absent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-10 09:48:49.000000000', 'files': ['osc_lib/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/osc-lib/commit/fe5fd5f41e1b91030336cb9ab8864c7fcd199d23', 'message': 'Avoid error if optional format fields are absent

Neutron has several fields which are optional and enabled via
extensions by the Operator. These fields are required by the
user, if the extension is enabled. But if the extension is disabled,
the output of a Create-* command might fail if the formatter
is of a dict/list object type.

This patch tries to resolve this issue, by verifying if data related
to the format for the optional fields are present or not.

Closes-Bug :#1654984

Change-Id: I97f804af7f99db79a78f4b7ded1b911dada7e936
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid error if optional format fields are absent

Neutron has several fields which are optional and enabled via
extensions by the Operator. These fields are required by the
user, if the extension is enabled. But if the extension is disabled,
the output of a Create-* command might fail if the formatter
is of a dict/list object type.

This patch tries to resolve this issue, by verifying if data related
to the format for the optional fields are present or not.

Closes-Bug :#1654984

Change-Id: I97f804af7f99db79a78f4b7ded1b911dada7e936
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osc-lib refs/changes/92/418292/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if field in formatters and data:
deleted_lines: if field in formatters and data is not None:

commit_message:
Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: I4955094aaffe6d0aa712b465ab344cc0d97d06de
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>

deleted_lines: set -euov# Install pip if [ ! commit_message:
fixed cluster::mysql requires mysql client installed

cluster::mysql calls `mysql` command in create-init-file
However mysql client package is not installed at a moment,
when this command is executed. Thus it fails.

Change-Id: Iaf4dd8f8ffe58e47bef07df04952d889a8c32212
Closes-Bug: #1638904
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>

commit_message:
Use only first two number from version in repositories file names

Otherwise during plugin update it creates multiple repository files.


Closes-bug: #1513956
Change-Id: Ie2e8288b3b701f07cb3c180e9b919860b7db562e
(cherry picked from commit 77e29ab206937efa05746451ebe86f94eb428a7f)

commit_message:
Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: I250396e74411f2990ed8e67908e0915979498bae
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_sahara refs/changes/73/417073/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set -xeuo pipefail# Install pip. if which pip; then# Install bindep and tox with pip.if which yum; then# Get a list of packages to install with bindep. If packages need to be # installed, bindep exits with an exit code of 1. BINDEP_PKGS=$(bindep -b -f bindep.txt test || true) echo "Packages to install: ${BINDEP_PKGS}" # Install a list of OS packages provided by bindep. if which apt-get; then --assume-yes install $BINDEP_PKGS elif which yum; then # Don't run yum with an empty list of packages. # It will fail and cause the script to exit with an error. if [[ ${#BINDEP_PKGS} > 0 ]]; then sudo yum install -y $BINDEP_PKGS fi# Loop through each tox environment and run tests. for tox_env in $(awk -F= '/envlist/ { gsub(",", " "); print $2 }' tox.ini); do echo "Executing tox environment: ${tox_env}" if [[ ${tox_env} == ansible-functional ]]; then else tox -e ${tox_env}
deleted_lines: set -euov# Install pip if [ ! "$(which pip)" ]; then# Install bindep and toxif [ "$(which yum)" ]; then# Install OS packages using bindep if apt-get -v >/dev/null 2>&1 ; then --assume-yes install `bindep -b -f bindep.txt test` else sudo yum install -y `bindep -b -f bindep.txt test`# run through each tox env and execute the test for tox_env in $(awk -F= '/envlist/ {print $2}' tox.ini | sed 's/,/ /g'); do if [ "${tox_env}" != "ansible-functional" ]; then tox -e ${tox_env} elif [ "${tox_env}" == "ansible-functional" ]; then

commit_message:
Replace deprecated identity options for tempest

The admin_* options in identity group are deprecated:
https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/config.py#L92-L114

Change-Id: I9c82e9d8c1f7db088a4b99ee82d8b2b3840364d4
Closes-bug: #1649174
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api refs/changes/84/409584/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: admin_username = admin admin_password = secretadmin admin_domain_name = default admin_project_name = admin
deleted_lines: admin_username = admin admin_password = secretadmin admin_domain_name = default admin_tenant_name = admin

commit_message:
Make update-from-keystone-admin-internal-api.yaml work on newton+

There are change of ServiceNetMapDefaults in service_net_map.j2.yaml but
were not reproduce in update-from-keystone-admin-internal-api.yaml
environment. Tested in newton.

Closes-Bug: #1646862

Change-Id: I307dcaabbc6d583896090bf3f046b442007fbc42
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Gregory Charot <gcharot@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup temporary files after content argument usage

When using content: the config_template module will create a
temporary file. This patch ensures a deterministic path to the
temp file is used, and removes it at the end of the module
execution.

Change-Id: I3b3354178ba1a2b9c95decb3d3e0c9a1c2689056
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins refs/changes/41/413641/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: I247fd8d9b3c5b153cb6837b39a77f5c7ca8aeb29
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>

commit_message:
Fixes to allow services startup after reboot

This change introduces small fixes required for system services
to start up after reboot of server.

Change-Id: I038b16c330422c8aa703c4dd0736920f979a10ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/00/414600/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: "Ensure services are running with current config" service: name={{ item }} state=restarted enabled=yes
deleted_lines: - name: "Ensure required services are started" service: name={{ item }} state=started # In the event that this server was already running, # we need to HUP the service to help ensure that it # has the latest configuration. We do this because we # cannot trust what service returns as each init system # behaves differently. - name: "Send services a reload signal" service: name={{ item }} state=reloaded with_items: - nginx

commit_message:
Make method import_versioned_module work

Oslo.utils 3.17 provides similar function, just use it.
For more information:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.utils/history.html

Closes-Bug: #1627313

Change-Id: Ie738e910cc72535fe97295d7e118eda2412ecd15
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/62/392462/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: from oslo_utils import importutilsdef import_versioned_module(version, submodule=None): module = 'heatclient.v%s' % version if submodule: module = '.'.join((module, submodule)) return importutils.import_module(module)

If packages need to be # installed, bindep exits with an exit code of 1. BINDEP_PKGS=$(bindep -b -f bindep.txt test || true) echo "Packages to install: ${BINDEP_PKGS}" # Install a list of OS packages provided by bindep. if which apt-get; then --assume-yes install $BINDEP_PKGS elif which yum; then # Don't run yum with an empty list of packages. # It will fail and cause the script to exit with an error. if [[ ${#BINDEP_PKGS} > 0 ]]; then sudo yum install -y $BINDEP_PKGS fi# Loop through each tox environment and run tests. for tox_env in $(awk -F= '/envlist/ { gsub(",", " "); print $2 }' tox.ini); do echo "Executing tox environment: ${tox_env}" if [[ ${tox_env} == ansible-functional ]]; then else tox -e ${tox_env}
deleted_lines: set -euov# Install pip if [ ! commit_message:
Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: Idfb0d26a6aec3abc836fbb216161fcc5e497402e
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>

deleted_lines: set -euov# Install pip if [ ! subject: Fix warning from PyCharm: Default argument value is mutable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-09 13:14:43.000000000', 'files': ['vitrage/datasources/transformer_base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/vitrage/commit/73f97e16d60805598319bdddb9e8f533743f69f8', 'message': 'Fix warning from PyCharm: Default argument value is mutable

> This inspection detects when a mutable value as list or dictionary is
> detected in a default value for an argument. Default argument values
> are evaluated only once at function definition time, which means that
> modifying the default value of the argument will affect all subsequent
> calls of the function.

Change-Id: Ia9c5928af3ef8d77f1885d7ddc2032433a13a6e2
Signed-off-by: Yujun Zhang <zhang.yujunz@zte.com.cn>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix warning from PyCharm: Default argument value is mutable

> This inspection detects when a mutable value as list or dictionary is
> detected in a default value for an argument. Default argument values
> are evaluated only once at function definition time, which means that
> modifying the default value of the argument will affect all subsequent
> calls of the function.

Change-Id: Ia9c5928af3ef8d77f1885d7ddc2032433a13a6e2
Signed-off-by: Yujun Zhang <zhang.yujunz@zte.com.cn>

commit_message:
Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: I362443afbc7cfc240762f2ce9e7db31d34bd612f
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins refs/changes/80/417080/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set -xeuo pipefail# Install pip. if which pip; then# Install bindep and tox with pip.if which yum; then# Get a list of packages to install with bindep. If packages need to be # installed, bindep exits with an exit code of 1. BINDEP_PKGS=$(bindep -b -f bindep.txt test || true) echo "Packages to install: ${BINDEP_PKGS}" # Install a list of OS packages provided by bindep. if which apt-get; then --assume-yes install $BINDEP_PKGS elif which yum; then # Don't run yum with an empty list of packages. # It will fail and cause the script to exit with an error. if [[ ${#BINDEP_PKGS} > 0 ]]; then sudo yum install -y $BINDEP_PKGS fi# Loop through each tox environment and run tests. for tox_env in $(awk -F= '/envlist/ { gsub(",", " "); print $2 }' tox.ini); do echo "Executing tox environment: ${tox_env}" if [[ ${tox_env} == ansible-functional ]]; then else tox -e ${tox_env}

commit_message:
neutron: kill non-dvr OVS scenario

The project is moving into DVR+HA direction for all gate jobs. At this
point, adding jobs that are not DVR+HA is counterproductive.

Of course, since Linuxbridge does not work with DVR yet, we keep that
other scenario job flavour as-is. But there is no excuse to care about
that non-dvr OVS job.

Change-Id: I7b029acd19d8705882792a0aa6ae4aac68a4253e

commit_message:
Reduce our 3-node labels to min-ready 0

While we have jobs using these labels today, they are still used very
little. Rather then having 6 nodes idle for days at a time, only
launch them when jobs are needed.

On average it takes about 30seconds for nodes to come online these
days.

Change-Id: I8e74b62f3556823e17468a4e2d22d42490fc44e6
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: Icca27d370bb4fce00474eee57073b29c52f2d011
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>

If packages need to be # installed, bindep exits with an exit code of 1. BINDEP_PKGS=$(bindep -b -f bindep.txt test || true) echo "Packages to install: ${BINDEP_PKGS}" # Install a list of OS packages provided by bindep. if which apt-get; then --assume-yes install $BINDEP_PKGS elif which yum; then # Don't run yum with an empty list of packages. # It will fail and cause the script to exit with an error. if [[ ${#BINDEP_PKGS} > 0 ]]; then sudo yum install -y $BINDEP_PKGS fi# Loop through each tox environment and run tests. for tox_env in $(awk -F= '/envlist/ { gsub(",", " "); print $2 }' tox.ini); do echo "Executing tox environment: ${tox_env}" if [[ ${tox_env} == ansible-functional ]]; then else tox -e ${tox_env}

commit_message:
Create new TripleO experimental job for Heat convergence

Create a new TripleO experimental job that will deploying OVB-nonha
scenario with Heat convergence enabled on the undercloud.

Run this job only for openstack/heat project in the experimental
pipeline.

Change-Id: I0178c3ee86b58e98e7bdfca435550539b40b0046

commit_message:
Deprecate the amqp1 dsvm-functional test on centos 7

In Ocata+ the dsvm-functional tests have been deprecated in favor of
simply running the functional tests directly via the tox-${env}-func
tests.

subject: RBD: the value of 'had_journaling' has not changed after 'update_features'.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-09 09:40:53.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/bd40f7de4bc548b458500ee148e02d46aa1045ef', 'message': "RBD: the value of 'had_journaling' has not changed after 'update_features'.

I find that in method '_enable_replication', if the volume has no feature of
'journaling', the value of 'had_journaling' will not be changed before and
after 'update_features', it's always 'None', so, the value of 'bool(had_journaling)'
will always be 'false', this value will be written to database finally. I think that's
a bug. I change the value of 'had_journaling' after 'update_features' by
adding 'had_journaling = image.features() & self.rbd.RBD_FEATURE_JOURNALING'.

Change-Id: I72435d20f2ffd315dc8642c2eb4e2f3f9be2359a
Closes-Bug: #1654126
"}]
commit_message:
RBD: the value of 'had_journaling' has not changed after 'update_features'.

I find that in method '_enable_replication', if the volume has no feature of
'journaling', the value of 'had_journaling' will not be changed before and
after 'update_features', it's always 'None', so, the value of 'bool(had_journaling)'
will always be 'false', this value will be written to database finally. I think that's
a bug. I change the value of 'had_journaling' after 'update_features' by
adding 'had_journaling = image.features() & self.rbd.RBD_FEATURE_JOURNALING'.

Change-Id: I72435d20f2ffd315dc8642c2eb4e2f3f9be2359a
Closes-Bug: #1654126
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/01/417801/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'replication_driver_data': '{"had_journaling": true}'

commit_message:
Distinguish between Java and Python for Mon

Detection plugins for monasca exists in particular for
monasca-api and monasca-persister. However they only support
proper detection of java based implementations.

Following change provides support for python based implementation.

Additionally written several missing unit tests for
Mon* detection plugins.

Fixes-Bug: #1642567
Change-Id: I76df0dec03ade146b96cc59e8dd9f9c394f30262

added_lines: def _get_impl_lang(process): """Return implementation language of the application behind process :param process: current process :type process: psutil.Process :return: implementation lang, either java or python :rtype: str """ p_exe = process.exe() if 'python' in p_exe: return 'python' return 'java' def __init__(self, template_dir, overwrite=True, args=None): super(MonAPI, self).__init__(template_dir, overwrite, args) self._detect_fn = { 'java': self._detect_java, 'python': self._detect_python } def _detect(self): """Detects if monasca-api runs in the system Method distinguishes between Java and Python implementation hence provides different agent's configuration. """ monasca_api = find_process_cmdline('monasca-api') if monasca_api is not None: impl = _get_impl_lang(monasca_api) self._detect_fn[impl](monasca_api) def _detect_java(self, process): # monasca-api can show up in urls and be an arg to this setup program, check port also # Find the right port from the config, this is specific to the Java version try: with open('/etc/monasca/api-config.yml', 'r') as config: self.api_config = yaml.safe_load(config.read()) api_port = self.api_config['server']['applicationConnectors'][0][ 'port'] except Exception: api_port = 8070 log.warning('Failed parsing /etc/monasca/api-config.yml, ' 'defaulting api port to {0}'.format(api_port)) for conn in process.connections('inet'): if conn.laddr[1] == api_port: self.available = True return def _detect_python(self, process): pass
deleted_lines: def _detect(self): """Run detection, set self.available True if the service is detected.""" monasca_api = monasca_setup.detection.find_process_cmdline('monasca-api') if monasca_api is not None: # monasca-api can show up in urls and be an arg to this setup program, check port also # Find the right port from the config, this is specific to the Java version try: with open('/etc/monasca/api-config.yml', 'r') as config: self.api_config = yaml.safe_load(config.read()) api_port = self.api_config['server']['applicationConnectors'][0]['port'] except Exception: api_port = 8070 log.warn('Failed parsing /etc/monasca/api-config.yml, defaulting api port to {0}'.format(api_port)) for conn in monasca_api.connections('inet'): if conn.laddr[1] == api_port: self.available = True return

for ubuntu and centos.

commit_message:
Default performance schema to off

The 5.6 version of mysql defauls to performance_schema=on at server
startup. This allocates all the memory that would be required to
handle max-connections plus several other memory settings.

We occasionally saw connection exhaustion in HA clouds with
max-connections near 2000. The common practice became to set
max-connections unrealistically high near 10k or 20k. In the move to
5.6 on Xenial this became a problem as the memory requirements for
values that high are unrealistic.

This change adds performance schema as a configuration option and
defaults to off giving 5.5 like behavior. It also considerably
updates documentation and highlights the need to carefully consider
memory related configuration settings for production environments.

Make the amulet test python2 and python3 capable.

Change-Id: Id01095ac2f73fa041b25b2602496a4c04a13e3ef
Partial-Bug: #1654086
Closes-Bug: #1600001
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-percona-cluster refs/changes/31/417131/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Memory Configuration ------------------- Percona Cluster is extremely memory sensitive. Setting memory values too low will give poor performance. Setting them too high will create problems that are very difficult to diagnose. Please take time to evaluate these settings for each deployment environment rather than copying and pasting bundle configurations. The Percona Cluster charm needs to be able to be deployed in small low memory development environments as well as high performance production environments. The charm configuration opinionated defaults favor the developer environment in order to ease initial testing. Production environments need to consider carefully the memory requirements for the hardware or cloud in use. Consult a MySQL memory calculator [2] to understand the implications of the values. Between the 5.5 and 5.6 releases a significant default was changed. The performance schema [1] defaulted to on for 5.6 and later. This allocates all the memory that would be required to handle max-connections plus several other memory settings. With 5.5 memory was allocated during runtime as needed. The charm now makes performance schema configurable and defaults to off (False). With the performance schema turned off memory is allocated when needed during run time. It is important to understand this can lead to run time memory exhaustion if the configuration values are set too high. Consult a MySQL memory calculator [2] to understand the implications of the values. Particularly consider the max-connections setting, this value is a balance between connection exhaustion and memory exhaustion. Occasionally connection exhaustion occurs in large production HA clouds with max-connections less than 2000. The common practice became to set max-connections unrealistically high near 10k or 20k. In the move to 5.6 on Xenial this became a problem as Percona would fail to start up or behave erratically as memory exhaustion occurred on the host due to performance schema being turned on. Even with the default now turned off this value should be carefully considered against the production requirements and resources available. [1] http://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/5.6/en/news-5-6-6.html#mysqld-5-6-6-performance-schema [2] http://www.mysqlcalculator.com/

commit_message:
Fix apt discrepancy around mysql client package

When we run galera/mysql packages installation
we can get into dependencies issues with  mysql
client package as it is not installed at the time
when perl dbd module requires it. At the same time
libperl-dbd-mysql is depending on it, so it fails.
Instead we need to ensure that mysql client is installed
along with its libraries prior to installing additional
packages for galera.

Change-Id: Idc91a399a46cd63c2201660bb248c0a0ad3fb9b8
Closes-bug: #1651182

commit_message:
Bring in syslog transport option

Add option to set syslog transport by means of
deployment facts modification:
  base_syslog:
    syslog_transport: udp | tcp

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1651437
Change-Id: I944ca4617b0dc754188cf9835d590e0666d9f2bf

commit_message:
Move rules from mangle/prerouting to filter/input

Move ddos-protection rules from mangle to filter table, because
mangle shouldn't be used for any filtering purpose.

Change-Id: I9d28be251d7e504892186bf5622d14bac88d6f3b
Closes-Bug: 1645353

commit_message:
Revert "Ignore heartbeats lock fails"

It seems that there are at least two level of ruby-stomp brokenness and
the fact that the mutex in original commit is locked actually means
there is no heartbeat received in time and we need to do something about
this.

This reverts commit 8318d7056556337f17f596edad9d7eed48ec3ca5.

Partial-Bug: #1644618
Change-Id: I565f430d17bcee2c50c0ddc8ecc11f3dc8b420ed
(cherry picked from commit 13b4d0f38e2a3e1c4d0ac0d91a7bce1dc23d7c8a)

commit_message:
Add DNS name change opportunity

When change DNS hostname in TLS certificate for OpenStack endpoints,
make additional conditions to allow services use new certificate.

Change-Id: Ia2724eb397962f569b8360e684b599c472a891e2
Closes-Bug: #1649886

commit_message:
fixed cluster::mysql requires mysql client installed

cluster::mysql calls `mysql` command in create-init-file
However mysql client package is not installed at a moment,
when this command is executed. Thus it fails.

Change-Id: Iaf4dd8f8ffe58e47bef07df04952d889a8c32212
Closes-Bug: #1638904
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>

commit_message:
Use Jewel as default Ceph release

Jewel has been the latest stable release for almost a year now and
Hammer was scheduled for EOL in 11/2016.

Reference the following for more information:
http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/releases/
https://www.spinics.net/lists/ceph-devel/msg34028.html

Change-Id: Id030688c2203cc11ac68a2c988c95b6850217b9f

commit_message:
Remove advertise_mtu config option

It was deprecated in Newton timeframe. Now we just clean it up from the
tree.

DocImpact: Any advertise_mtu option notions in documentation should be
removed.

UpgradeImpact: After upgrade, all DHCPv4 subnets will see the MTU option
served via corresponding DHCPv4 option. Also, all IPv6 subnets connected
to routers will see MTU set in Router Advertisement messages.

NeutronLibImpact: This patch will break any 3party plugins that directly
access the configuration option.

Change-Id: I31e15018fe764de0fe4d6de7da3c1d9f2cc1d532
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/67/413567/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - The ``advertise_mtu`` option is removed. Now Neutron always uses all available means to advertise MTUs to instances (including DHCPv4 and IPv6 RA).

subject: Make private network optional
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-30 14:42:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/4a63a637773a9abc862c927695a31fdbb5d3df96', 'message': '[WIP] Make private network optional

If a fixed_network is specified no private network is created by the
templates and the specified network is used instead for VMs
provisioning, like in the Ironic driver.  Floating IPs are now
optional for the Swarm driver as in k8s.

If LBaaS is enabled a subnet is needed, so if private cluster network
is disabled (fixed_network specified) and LBaaS enabled we need
fixed_subnet specified.

external_network_id is not mandatory when FloatingIPs are disabled.

Change-Id: I2003eb709b22b905063d846eb71570fc5e033618
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-03 12:26:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/5cb04e9714fe604f8719c358d1c0de447330c710', 'message': '[WIP] Make private network optional

provisioning, like in the Ironic driver.  Floating IPs are now
optional for the Swarm driver as in k8s.

If LBaaS is enabled a subnet is needed, so if private cluster network
is disabled (fixed_network specified) and LBaaS enabled we need
fixed_subnet specified.

external_network_id is not mandatory when FloatingIPs are disabled.

'}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2016-10-18 14:50:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/b7118a16b35f23e16620500e19b66331de028b80', 'message': 'Make private network optional

If a fixed_network is specified no private network is created by the
templates and the specified network is used instead for VMs
provisioning, like in the Ironic driver.  Floating IPs are now
optional for the Swarm driver as in k8s.

If LBaaS is enabled a subnet is needed, so if private cluster network
is disabled (fixed_network specified) and LBaaS enabled we need
fixed_subnet specified.

external_network_id is not mandatory when FloatingIPs are disabled.

Implements: blueprint decouple-private-network
Change-Id: I2003eb709b22b905063d846eb71570fc5e033618

commit_message:
Make private network optional

If a fixed_network and fixed_subnet is specified no private network
is created by the templates and the specified network is
used instead for VMs provisioning, like in the Ironic driver.

Currently missing is the code to handle the use case where you
specify a fixed_network but not a fixed_subnet, this will come
in a following patch.

Partially Implements: blueprint decouple-private-network
Change-Id: I2003eb709b22b905063d846eb71570fc5e033618
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/54/380354/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - port: {get_attr: [port_switcher, port_id]} port_switcher: type: Magnum::PortSwitcher properties: port_id_with_subnet: {get_resource: port_with_subnet} port_ip_with_subnet: {get_attr: [port_with_subnet, fixed_ips, 0, ip_address]} port_id_without_subnet: {get_resource: port_without_subnet} port_ip_without_subnet: {get_attr: [port_without_subnet, fixed_ips, 0, ip_address]} port_with_subnet: type: Magnum::Optional::Neutron::PortWithSubnet properties: network: {get_param: fixed_network} fixed_ips: - subnet: {get_param: fixed_subnet} security_groups: - {get_param: secgroup_base_id} - {get_param: secgroup_mesos_id} replacement_policy: AUTO port_without_subnet: type: Magnum::Optional::Neutron::PortWithoutSubnet type: Magnum::Optional::Neutron::FloatingIP port_id: {get_attr: [port_switcher, port_id]} address: {get_attr: [port_switcher, port_ip]} value: {get_attr: [port_switcher, port_ip]}
deleted_lines: - port: {get_resource: mesos_master_eth0} mesos_master_eth0: type: OS::Neutron::Port fixed_ips: - subnet: {get_param: fixed_subnet} type: OS::Neutron::FloatingIP port_id: {get_resource: mesos_master_eth0} address: {get_attr: [mesos_master_eth0, fixed_ips, 0, ip_address]} value: {get_attr: [mesos_master_eth0, fixed_ips, 0, ip_address]}

commit_message:
Fullstack test for request(release) pool and address

Change-Id: I51d780660a27b032863fdb25506d55cf9e83a545
Closes-Bug: #1652563
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork refs/changes/03/414903/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_container_ipam_request_release_pool(self): fake_ipam = { "Driver": "kuryr", "Options": {}, "Config": [ { "Subnet": "10.11.0.0/16", "IPRange": "10.11.0.0/24", "Gateway": "10.11.0.1" } ] } container_net_name = lib_utils.get_random_string(8) container_net = self.docker_client.create_network( name=container_net_name, driver='kuryr', ipam=fake_ipam) container_net_id = container_net.get('Id') try: networks = self.neutron_client.list_networks( tags=utils.make_net_tags(container_net_id)) except Exception as e: self.docker_client.remove_network(container_net_id) message = ("Failed to list neutron networks: %s") self.fail(message % e.args[0]) self.assertEqual(1, len(networks['networks'])) # Currently we cannot get IPAM pool from docker client. pool_name = "kuryrPool-" + "10.11.0.0/24" subnetpools = self.neutron_client.list_subnetpools(name=pool_name) self.assertEqual(1, len(subnetpools['subnetpools'])) # Boot a container, and connect to the docker network. container_name = lib_utils.get_random_string(8) container = self.docker_client.create_container( image='kuryr/busybox', command='/bin/sleep 600', hostname='kuryr_test_container', name=container_name) warn_msg = container.get('Warning') container_id = container.get('Id') self.assertIsNone(warn_msg, 'Warn in creating container') self.assertIsNotNone(container_id, 'Create container id must not ' 'be None') self.docker_client.start(container=container_id) self.docker_client.connect_container_to_network(container_id, container_net_id) try: ports = self.neutron_client.list_ports( network_id=networks['networks'][0]['id']) except Exception as e: self.docker_client.disconnect_container_from_network( container_id, container_net_id) message = ("Failed to list neutron ports: %s") self.fail(message % e.args[0]) # DHCP port and container endpoint self.assertEqual(2, len(ports['ports'])) # Disconnect container from network, this release ip address. self.docker_client.disconnect_container_from_network(container_id, container_net_id) ports = self.neutron_client.list_ports( network_id=networks['networks'][0]['id']) self.assertEqual(1, len(ports['ports'])) # Delete docker network, if no endpoint, will release the pool # and delete the subnetpool in Neutron. self.docker_client.stop(container=container_id) self.docker_client.remove_network(container_net_id) subnetpools = self.neutron_client.list_subnetpools(name=pool_name) self.assertEqual(0, len(subnetpools['subnetpools']))

commit_message:
H402 hacking have been deprecated

H402 hacking have been removed since hacking 0.10.
https://github.com/openstack-dev/hacking/blob/master/setup.cfg
test-requirements of kuryr-libnetwork require hacking <0.11,>=0.10.0.
So remove H402 ignore statement
Closes-Bug: #1654117

Change-Id: I72c8321c62692d86c8a4b1b3b705440d97d124ef

commit_message:
Add driver variable to ODL tempest jobs

The driver variable is used to determine which driver to use for each
tempest job, the valid options are either v1driver or v2driver.

Change-Id: Ic96a8b0453832f01dc692ea8e77902a555795236

subject: RBD: the value of 'had_journaling' has not changed after 'update_features'.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-09 09:09:44.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/6721da8983b310ad79d4ffdcefd95c4a1249cebb', 'message': "RBD: the value of 'had_journaling' has not changed after 'update_features'.

I find that in method '_enable_replication', if the volume has no feature of
'journaling', the value of 'had_journaling' will not be changed before and
after 'update_features', it's always 'None', so, the value of 'bool(had_journaling)'
will always be 'false', this value will be written to database finally. I think that's
a bug. I change the value of 'had_journaling' after 'update_features' by
adding 'had_journaling = image.features() & self.rbd.RBD_FEATURE_JOURNALING'.

Change-Id: I4735f303cf22c3f162d6a55b55b300a6900bfed6
Closes-Bug: #1654126
"}]
commit_message:
RBD: the value of 'had_journaling' has not changed after 'update_features'.

I find that in method '_enable_replication', if the volume has no feature of
'journaling', the value of 'had_journaling' will not be changed before and
after 'update_features', it's always 'None', so, the value of 'bool(had_journaling)'
will always be 'false', this value will be written to database finally. I think that's
a bug. I change the value of 'had_journaling' after 'update_features' by
adding 'had_journaling = image.features() & self.rbd.RBD_FEATURE_JOURNALING'.

Change-Id: I4735f303cf22c3f162d6a55b55b300a6900bfed6
Closes-Bug: #1654126
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/96/417796/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'replication_driver_data': '{"had_journaling": true}'

commit_message:
Add update neighbors tests

1. test neighbor changing label
2. test neighbor changing label when the neighbor is with placeholder=True

Change-Id: Ifa1c3ac8d215431508bd9b4c214b2e88f79481de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/17/417917/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from vitrage.common.constants import EdgeProperties as EProps def test_update_neighbors_by_changing_label(self): # create instance event with host neighbor and check validity (vertex, neighbors, processor) = self._create_and_check_entity() # update instance event with state running (neighbor_vertex, neighbor_edge) = neighbors[0] old_label = neighbor_edge.label neighbor_vertex[VProps.IS_PLACEHOLDER] = False processor.entity_graph.update_vertex(neighbor_vertex) neighbor_vertex[VProps.IS_PLACEHOLDER] = True neighbor_edge.label = 'new label' processor._update_neighbors(vertex, neighbors) # check state self._check_graph(processor, self.NUM_VERTICES_AFTER_CREATION, self.NUM_EDGES_AFTER_CREATION, vertex_id=vertex.vertex_id) old_edge = processor.entity_graph.get_edge(neighbor_vertex.vertex_id, vertex.vertex_id, old_label) new_edge = processor.entity_graph.get_edge(neighbor_vertex.vertex_id, vertex.vertex_id, neighbor_edge.label) self.assertIsNotNone(old_edge) self.assertEqual(old_edge[EProps.IS_DELETED], True) self.assertIsNotNone(new_edge) self.assertEqual(new_edge[EProps.IS_DELETED], False) # update instance with the same neighbor processor._update_neighbors(vertex, neighbors) # check state self._check_graph(processor, self.NUM_VERTICES_AFTER_CREATION, self.NUM_EDGES_AFTER_CREATION, vertex_id=vertex.vertex_id) def test_update_neighbors_by_changing_label_with_placeholder(self): # create instance event with host neighbor and check validity (vertex, neighbors, processor) = self._create_and_check_entity() # update instance event with state running (neighbor_vertex, neighbor_edge) = neighbors[0] old_label = neighbor_edge.label neighbor_edge.label = 'new label' processor._update_neighbors(vertex, neighbors) # check state self._check_graph(processor, self.NUM_VERTICES_AFTER_CREATION, self.NUM_EDGES_AFTER_CREATION, vertex_id=vertex.vertex_id) old_edge = processor.entity_graph.get_edge(neighbor_vertex.vertex_id, vertex.vertex_id, old_label) new_edge = processor.entity_graph.get_edge(neighbor_vertex.vertex_id, vertex.vertex_id, neighbor_edge.label) self.assertIsNone(old_edge) self.assertIsNotNone(new_edge) self.assertEqual(new_edge[EProps.IS_DELETED], False) # update instance with the same neighbor processor._update_neighbors(vertex, neighbors) # check state self._check_graph(processor, self.NUM_VERTICES_AFTER_CREATION, self.NUM_EDGES_AFTER_CREATION, vertex_id=vertex.vertex_id) def _check_graph(self, processor, num_vertices, num_edges, vertex_id=None): if not vertex_id: self.assertEqual(num_edges, processor.entity_graph.num_edges()) else: deleted_edges = processor.entity_graph.get_edges( vertex_id, attr_filter={VProps.IS_DELETED: True}) self.assertEqual(num_edges + len(deleted_edges), processor.entity_graph.num_edges())
deleted_lines: def _check_graph(self, processor, num_vertices, num_edges): self.assertEqual(num_edges, processor.entity_graph.num_edges())

Add manage/unmanage to DISCO driver

This commit is to add the feature manage/unmanage a volume for
DISCO volume driver of ITRI.

It also includes the unit tests.

commit_message:
Allow storlet header parameters value to have ':' symbols

Header based storlet parameters have the following format:
X-Storlet-Parameter-<index>: key:value

The current code fails if the value has more then one ':'
symbol. The current patch fixes this behavior.

This facilitates the ability to send a serialized json
dictionary as a parameter.

Change-Id: I9155f4d3dc336806d175e88322a4334efe2de941

commit_message:
Resolve dependencies hell in mitaka branch

- block kombu 4.0 release
    kombu v4 conflicts with oslo.messaging and openstack global
    requirement for mitaka release so we have to block it
    for reviving ostf gates.
- add upper constraint to keystonemiddleware
    4.11 and higher requires python-keystoneclient>=3.6 which conflicts
    with global requirements
- add python-openstackclient requirement
    python-saharaclient requires it but newest openstackclient conflicts
    with keystoneclient
- add upper constaint to python-saharaclient
    as mentioned above new saharaclient requires new openstackclient which
    requires new keystoneclient. pin it to mitaka-compatible package.

Change-Id: I59b371b0d580c020cd7120d8c40c0338b835795b

commit_message:
Correct the wrong calling 'getExternalNetworkIdForRouter'

In 'io.murano.system.NetworkExplorer', there is a
'get_external_network_id_for_network' method calling
'getExternalNetworkIdForRouter' to get external network id for specific
router interface, which should be 'get_external_network_id_for_router'

Change-Id: Id2046106e274b8f6682703659ab8e27233d49209
Closes-Bug: #1638923

commit_message:
RBD: two types of 'volume_type' should be handled respectively.

When creating a new volume, the 'volume_type' passed to
method '_is_replicated_type' is an instance of 'VolumeType', which
has attribute of 'extra_specs'. But when retyping a volume ,the 'volume_type'
passed to the method is a dictionary, which has no attribute of 'extra_specs',
so, the return value will always be 'False', that is means, the volume will
not be replicated. These two cases should be handled respectively.

Change-Id: I35c44df574d88d15526edade1ef56bb3a1c11686
Closes-Bug: #1653917

commit_message:
use osc-lib git master branch

osc-lib bug/1652025 is fixed with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/417675/
Wihtout the fix devstack fails with router creation with
"TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable".
The fix isn't published at pypi yet. Until the new version of osc-lib
(probably as 1.3), use git master branch of osc-lib.

Change-Id: I11c0a8f106c48c89ac2bb6189fee04cb7c126e01
Related-bug: #1652025

commit_message:
Add unit tests for instance failure flow

Change-Id: I45b4a4ffa2ecb9f7cf56a3c5d16d3708fe584fc0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari refs/changes/41/396241/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 NTT DATA # All Rights Reserved. # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Unit Tests for instance failure TaskFlow """ import mock from oslo_config import cfg from masakari.compute import nova from masakari import context from masakari.engine.drivers.taskflow import instance_failure from masakari import exception from masakari import test from masakari.tests.unit import fakes CONF = cfg.CONF class HostFailureTestCase(test.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(HostFailureTestCase, self).setUp() self.ctxt = context.get_admin_context() # overriding 'wait_period_after_power_off' and # 'wait_period_after_power_on' to 2 seconds to # reduce the wait period. CONF.set_override('wait_period_after_power_off', 2) CONF.set_override('wait_period_after_power_on', 2) def _test_stop_instance(self, instance_id, novaclient): task = instance_failure.StopInstanceTask(novaclient) task.execute(self.ctxt, instance_id) # verfiy instance is stopped instance = novaclient.get_server(self.ctxt, instance_id) self.assertEqual('stopped', getattr(instance, 'OS-EXT-STS:vm_state')) def _test_confirm_instance_is_active(self, instance_id, novaclient): task = instance_failure.ConfirmInstanceActiveTask(novaclient) task.execute(self.ctxt, instance_id) # verfiy instance is in active state instance = novaclient.get_server(self.ctxt, instance_id) self.assertEqual('active', getattr(instance, 'OS-EXT-STS:vm_state')) @mock.patch('masakari.compute.nova.novaclient') def test_instance_failure_flow(self, _mock_novaclient): instance_id = '1' _mock_novaclient.return_value = fakes.FakeNovaClient( host='fake-host') novaclient = nova.API() # test StopInstanceTask self._test_stop_instance(instance_id, novaclient) # test StartInstanceTask task = instance_failure.StartInstanceTask(novaclient) task.execute(self.ctxt, instance_id) # test ConfirmInstanceActiveTask self._test_confirm_instance_is_active(instance_id, novaclient) @mock.patch('masakari.compute.nova.novaclient') def test_instance_failure_flow_resized_instance(self, _mock_novaclient): instance_id = '1' _mock_novaclient.return_value = fakes.FakeNovaClient( host='fake-host', vm_state='resized') novaclient = nova.API() # test StopInstanceTask self._test_stop_instance(instance_id, novaclient) # test StartInstanceTask task = instance_failure.StartInstanceTask(novaclient) task.execute(self.ctxt, instance_id) # test ConfirmInstanceActiveTask self._test_confirm_instance_is_active(instance_id, novaclient) @mock.patch('masakari.compute.nova.novaclient') def test_instance_failure_flow_stop_failed(self, _mock_novaclient): instance_id = '1' _mock_novaclient.return_value = fakes.FakeNovaClient( host='fake-host') novaclient = nova.API() # test StopInstanceTask task = instance_failure.StopInstanceTask(novaclient) with mock.patch.object(novaclient, 'stop_server'): self.assertRaises( exception.InstanceRecoveryFailureException, task.execute, self.ctxt, instance_id) @mock.patch('masakari.compute.nova.novaclient') def test_instance_failure_flow_not_ha_enabled(self, _mock_novaclient): instance_id = '1' _mock_novaclient.return_value = fakes.FakeNovaClient( host='fake-host', create_ha_enabled=False) novaclient = nova.API() # test StopInstanceTask task = instance_failure.StopInstanceTask(novaclient) self.assertRaises( exception.SkipInstanceRecoveryException, task.execute, self.ctxt, instance_id) @mock.patch('masakari.compute.nova.novaclient') def test_instance_failure_flow_start_failed(self, _mock_novaclient): instance_id = '1' _mock_novaclient.return_value = fakes.FakeNovaClient( host='fake-host') novaclient = nova.API() # test StopInstanceTask self._test_stop_instance(instance_id, novaclient) # test StartInstanceTask task = instance_failure.StartInstanceTask(novaclient) with mock.patch.object(novaclient, 'start_server'): task.execute(self.ctxt, instance_id) # test ConfirmInstanceActiveTask task = instance_failure.ConfirmInstanceActiveTask(novaclient) self.assertRaises( exception.InstanceRecoveryFailureException, task.execute, self.ctxt, instance_id) def tearDown(self): CONF.clear_override('wait_period_after_power_off') CONF.clear_override('wait_period_after_power_on') super(HostFailureTestCase, self).tearDown()

commit_message:
Add support for ceph-osd broker requests

This is to support ceph-osd requesting movement
of OSD devices into various buckets.

This also implements the osd side with
an action to move a disk

Change-Id: I609ceb8662b20ca06b71d66696d101bda799e25c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph refs/changes/92/408292/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/python # # Copyright 2016 Canonical Ltd # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import os import psutil import sys sys.path.append('lib') sys.path.append('hooks') from charmhelpers.core.hookenv import ( config, action_get, action_fail, ) from charmhelpers.contrib.storage.linux.ceph import ( CephBrokerRq, send_request_if_needed, is_request_complete, ) import ceph from ceph_hooks import ( assess_status, get_journal_devices, ) def add_device(request, device_path, bucket=None): ceph.osdize(dev, config('osd-format'), get_journal_devices(), config('osd-reformat'), config('ignore-device-errors'), config('osd-encrypt')) # Make it fast! if config('autotune'): ceph.tune_dev(dev) mounts = filter(lambda disk: '/dev/xvdb' in disk.device, psutil.disk_partitions()) if mounts: osd = mounts[0] osd_id = osd.mountpoint.split('/')[-1].split('-')[-1] request.ops.append({ 'op': 'move-osd-to-bucket', 'osd': "osd.{}".format(osd_id), 'bucket': bucket}) return request def get_devices(): return [ os.path.realpath(path) for path in action_get('osd-devices').split(' ')] if __name__ == "__main__": request = CephBrokerRq() for dev in get_devices(): request = add_device(request=request, device_path=dev, bucket=action_get("bucket")) send_request_if_needed(request, relation='mon')

commit_message:
RBD: two types of 'volume_type' should be handled respectively.

When creating a new volume, the 'volume_type' passed to
method '_is_replicated_type' is an instance of 'VolumeType', which
has attribute of 'extra_specs'. But when retyping a volume ,the 'volume_type'
passed to the method is a dictionary, which has no attribute of 'extra_specs',
so, the return value will always be 'False', that is means, the volume will
not be replicated. These two cases should be handled respectively.
Closes-Bug: #1653917

Change-Id: I19743771ec81bbdbc2c71b7aedcb38f9a84913a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/85/417785/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
listing revoke events should be admin only

Currently any user can list revocation events, this data contains
IDs for users and projects. It should not be made available to
any user that is able to authenticate, it should be an admin
only API call.

Change-Id: I4290163c67c84ef0e1a2f6ee967ddf2acb2c3212
Closes-Bug: 1649446

commit_message:
Refactor: Move domainEventRegisterAny method in a loop

There are 9 occurrences in the code where domainEventRegisterAny
method is defined in the _virt_event method of the
InstancemonitorManager class.

This patch is intended to move the domainEventRegisterAny
method in a loop to reduce size of code.

Change-Id: Ie827d2ebb7a9bf923a3429ed1ac95fe75dce66f7

commit_message:
Get glance+rally to work under python3

tests/ci/osresources.py:
* specify a key for sorted to work properly under py3x. The response
  from _deduplicate is a list with both strings and lists.
* response from check_output is a byte array in python3, so we need
  to turn that into a string which json.loads needs

Change-Id: Iad684554d4c618bffc394c67ae85d276fbeb7f99

commit_message:
Support PYTHON3 gate jobs

Look for the DEVSTACK_GATE_USE_PYTHON3 and choose the correct
version of python

Change-Id: Ib61da6bebb7bed9db7524c5f7faffcb6786c1140

commit_message:
H305/H402 hacking have been deprecated

H305/H402 hacking have been removed since hacking 0.10.
https://github.com/openstack-dev/hacking/blob/master/setup.cfg
test-requirements of coverage2sql require hacking<0.11,>=0.10..
So remove H305/H402 ignore statement
Closes-Bug: #1653639

Change-Id: I781fc185b3a70e0c9e12ae0eeab16d2d54925421

commit_message:
X-Serivce-Token should be hashed in the log

Currently, logs display the hash values of X-Auth-Token,
Authorization, and X-Subject-Token, but not the value of
the X-Service-Token.  This patch set adds the X-Service-Token
to the list of header fields to be hashed for logging purposes.

Change-Id: I4d996a2631f61a2c9bbbc7f959e97c7279be023d
Closes-Bug: #1654847
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/87/418087/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | The ``X-Service-Token`` header value is now properly masked, and is displayed as a hash value, in the log.

commit_message:
used openstack cli in magnum devstack plugin

Currently magnum CI tests(magnum/tests/contrib/post_test_hook.sh) uses
python clients(nova,neutron, glance) for openstack operations.
We should start using openstack client instead.

Closes-Bug: #1653875

Change-Id: I00aab79ccf3e267be77115a8847d72c8f6e32075
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/93/417393/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: openstack subnet set private-subnet --dns-nameserver 8.8.8.8 export NIC_ID=$(openstack network show public | awk '/ id /{print $4}') #NOTE(prameswar): openstack cli not giving container format in # command 'openstack image list' once it start supporting we have to add. openstack keypair create --pub-key ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub default openstack flavor create m1.magnum --id 100 --ram 1024 --disk 10 --vcpus 1 openstack flavor create s1.magnum --id 200 --ram 512 --disk 10 --vcpus 1 openstack keypair delete default openstack flavor delete m1.magnum openstack flavor delete s1.magnum
deleted_lines: neutron subnet-update private-subnet --dns-nameserver 8.8.8.8 export NIC_ID=$(neutron net-show public | awk '/ id /{print $4}') nova keypair-add --pub-key ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub default nova flavor-create m1.magnum 100 1024 10 1 nova flavor-create s1.magnum 200 512 10 1nova keypair-delete default nova flavor-delete m1.magnum nova flavor-delete s1.magnum

commit_message:
Fix the docs error

The docutils 0.13.1 release breaks some documentation jobs
when it tries to build docs with remote images. This has been reported
upstream[0]. The version matches the supported docutils versions for
sphinx. The requirements patch is here: [1]

[0] https://sourceforge.net/p/docutils/bugs/301/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409529/

Change-Id: I1ab3a06167798efbb5a3a683947483d1dd1c65d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/coverage2sql refs/changes/52/417452/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: docutils>=0.11,!=0.13.1 # OSI-Approved Open Source, Public Domain

commit_message:
Add support for not using admin_token in Ceph/RGW

This patch add the option for using Keyston V3 authention with
the Ceph/RGW service instead of using the admin_token

Change-Id: I42861afcac221478dcb68be13b6dbc2533a7f158
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/67/405567/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Add support for configuring Ceph RGW to use keystone V3 service authentication instead of admin token authentication

subject: Fix "Message object do not support addition".
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-23 10:00:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/1c9774bd0b91df73d1858c01fc45386768b84d10', 'message': 'Fix "Message object do not support addition".

We are doing addition for message objects in serveral
places and this may cause error.

Change-Id: I11a490f759fdac9707c1321c9659da2605196a94
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-24 01:40:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/065e5151add0d4361d659fcb9dd34635b1a30f10', 'message': 'Fix "Message object do not support addition".

We are doing addition for message objects in serveral
places and this may cause error.

Change-Id: I11a490f759fdac9707c1321c9659da2605196a94
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-24 03:00:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/c707ac2c82dc518d169d1ca7e57195784f551abb', 'message': 'Fix "Message object do not support addition".

In the 7.0.0 Novaclient release we added some warning
log about user should using "endpoint_type" rather than
"interface" when init novaclient:
https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/client.py#L312-L327

https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/client.py#L249-L272

This is now causing alot jenkins failures acroos projects
that is using novaclient with enable_lazy set to False.
As in this kind of scenario the warning message is a message
object instead of unicode sting and it cannot be added:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.i18n/tree/oslo_i18n/_message.py#n227

and "Message object do not support addition" will raise.

Related Jenkins Error:
Ceilometer:
http://logs.openstack.org/29/333129/3/check/gate-ceilometer-python27-ubuntu-xenial/bd125e7/

Closes-bug: #1652414
Change-Id: I11a490f759fdac9707c1321c9659da2605196a94
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-24 03:59:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/d2c7a58d39ef3421b09d2b2b33f1f2235d12a17c', 'message': 'Fix "Message object do not support addition".

log about user should using "endpoint_type" rather than
"interface" when init novaclient:

This is now causing a lot jenkins failures acroos projects
that is using novaclient with enable_lazy set to False.
As in this kind of scenario the warning message is a message
object instead of unicode sting and it cannot be added:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.i18n/tree/oslo_i18n/_message.py#n227

and "Message object do not support addition" will raise.

Related Jenkins Error:

Closes-bug: #1652414
Change-Id: I11a490f759fdac9707c1321c9659da2605196a94

commit_message:
Fix "Message object do not support addition".

In the 7.0.0 Novaclient release we added some warning
log about user should using "endpoint_type" rather than
"interface" when init novaclient:
https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/client.py#L312-L327

https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/client.py#L249-L272

This is now causing a lot jenkins failures acroos projects
that is using novaclient with enable_lazy set to False.
As in this kind of scenario the warning message is a message
object instead of unicode sting and it cannot be added:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.i18n/tree/oslo_i18n/_message.py#n227

and "Message object do not support addition" will raise.

Related Jenkins Error:
Ceilometer:
http://logs.openstack.org/29/333129/3/check/gate-ceilometer-python27-ubuntu-xenial/bd125e7/

Closes-bug: #1652414
Change-Id: I11a490f759fdac9707c1321c9659da2605196a94

commit_message:
X-Serivce-Token should be hashed in the log

Currently, logs display the hash values of X-Auth-Token,
Authorization, and X-Subject-Token, but not the value of
the X-Service-Token.  This patch set adds the X-Service-Token
to the list of header fields to be hashed for logging purposes.

Change-Id: I4d996a2631f61a2c9bbbc7f959e97c7279be023d
Closes-Bug: #1654847
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/88/418088/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix venv build fallback mechanism

Fixes the ability to deploy a venv in cases where:
1) developer_mode is not enabled
2) A cached venv is not downloaded from the repo server

Also introduced is a var that can be used to disable the cached venv
download attempt entirely and force the fallback behavior. Previously
that would have been available by simply setting the venv download
to some broken URL like "http://localhost/none", but
keystone_venv_download will allow for much easier disabling of the
cached venv download behavior.

Change-Id: Ifb07eb2a73cc3478a36177d53a9a2b0579da4e12
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/39/417039/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # venv_download, even when true, will use the fallback method of building the # venv from scratch if the venv download fails. keystone_venv_download: "{{ keystone_developer_mode | ternary('false', 'true') }}"

ambiguous network errors when booting a server because we're

commit_message:
Check error message returned by the system

As in If84b7dc1f4b7681169d9041288169d81c5ebe586,
testcases should check the error message returned by
the system, not the error message defined in Tempest,
that is meaningless.

Change-Id: I119716dfd76c180ebf40abc353184aee29ebac00

commit_message:
Add orm type check for paginate_query

Cinder rasises 500 error if the sort key is the resources'
object property.

This patch add the type check to prevent querying with non-ORM
propery.

Change-Id: Ia7de86435d4af865c20bcd2b6f9b24ccf3b1dca2
Closes-bug: #1653197
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/08/415808/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from cinder.db import api if not api.is_orm_value(sort_key_attr): raise exception.InvalidInput(reason='Invalid sort key')

commit_message:
Pecan: Fix subresource policy check

THe policy enforcement hook was not inserting the parent resource name
when checking that a policy action was supported.

Change-Id: Iee5dd06c4c2ff8e73337946ab40faa455873aa4d

commit_message:
Add support for using the default subnetpool

Allows to pass use_default_subnetpool instead of a cidr. This is
required when adding an IPv6 subnet if BGP or prefix delegation is
enabled.

Change-Id: Icf7c212ee730d631599fba732f66679c5cd2916d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/19/416319/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ipv6_ra_mode=None, ipv6_address_mode=None, use_default_subnetpool=False): :param bool use_default_subnetpool: Use the default subnetpool for ip_version to obtain a CIDR. if cidr: subnet['cidr'] = cidr if use_default_subnetpool: subnet['use_default_subnetpool'] = True
